attributes.action: Technical and financial support to fossil fuel and steel industry for survival.
attributes.background:
Coal fired power stations and steel industry are facing an uncertain future due to environmental policy changes implemented by UK and EU government.
Need a taskforce under UK govt. to monitor these industrial sector and declare a financial and technical support package to protect and reform them.
attributes.additional_details: Ferrybridge and Eggbrough power stations announced plant closure recently. TATA Steel closed its Scunthorpe plant partially and made more than one thousand workers redundant across UK. Many coal mines closed and workers lost jobs. UK government should support these industries financially and technically to reform to suit present climate change regulations. Also need a plan to protect the workforce through retraining and rehabilitate them in future redundancies or closures arise.

attributes.action: To ask the UK government to call a General Election after the referendum
attributes.background:
After the referendum the nation will have made a decision in relation to the direction with which to take the country. 

This is more important in the event of a vote leave result

Its only fair and democratic that the citizens of the UK are allowed to chose a government to lead through change

attributes.action: Make it obligatory for teachers to hold Qualified Teaching Status
attributes.background: With the goal of all schools to be academies by 2020, by then there will be no general requirements for who can and cannot teach the children. This petition is to make it the law that teachers are qualified to at least degree level, with QTS before they are allowed to teach children.
attributes.additional_details: Children deserve to be educated by individuals who are competent. The value of university will be something of the past without the necessity to train.

attributes.action: Ban remote gambling nationwide, it is dangerous and destroying lives.
attributes.background: British families are being destroyed by remote (online) gambling. Individuals can easily lose property, retirement funds, business money, savings, and wages from the comfort of their homes and within hours resulting in suicide, depression, divorce and losing their children. It needs to be banned.
attributes.additional_details: Under section 24 of the Gambling Act 2005 - 'Children and other vulnerable people are protected from being harmed or exploited by gambling'. Age vertification and self-exclusion are not enough to protect the children of problem gamblers or the millions of UK citizens who would be deemed 'vulnerable'. Since most online gambling operators are based outside of the UK there is no financial gain for the British people that would remotely justify these companies being able to transact with or advertise to consumers in Britain.

attributes.action: Hold MP's accountable for their conduct in the houses of Parliament.
attributes.background: We are sick of seeing our elected representatives behaving like braying adolescents and would like to see a disciplinary process put in place to deal with individuals who behave in this disrespectful manner, with a 3 strike system that could result in them being banned from the house of commons.
attributes.additional_details: Any MP's falling foul of three strikes should be forced into a by election in their constituencies so that their electorate can decide whether they want these people representing them further in the house of commons.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to privatise the NHS
attributes.background: Protect the NHS by introducing legislation to make privatisation now, or in the future impossible by any government. Access to a free NHS is a right of the British people and should be sacrosanct.
attributes.additional_details: See the will of the British people

attributes.action: David Cameron should apologise for calling asylum seekers a "bunch of migrants".
attributes.background:
David Cameron's view is (clearly) not that of every British person. Particularly on Holocaust Memorial Day it seems one that voters would ask him to apologise for expressing. 
The asylum seekers in the Calais camps are living in squalor. They need our help.
attributes.additional_details: TBC

attributes.action: Allow Diagnosed Transgender persons the right to change their Birth Certificate
attributes.background: We the undersigned do petition the Hm Government in light of Transgenderism being recognised as a Medical Condition to allow Diagnosed Transgender persons the right to change their Birth Certificate without resort to Gender Reassignment Surgery or need to apply for a Gender Recognition Certificate
attributes.additional_details: It is now accepted by the scientific and Medical Fraternity that Transgenderism is a recognised Medical Condition , it is widely accepted that this is due to the breakdown of the SRY Gene . Brain scans carried out by several universities have shown recognisable differences in the Transgender Brain . Transgender persons are mentally Assessed prior to Diagnoses and are found to be at odds with their Gender as assigned at Birth . We are able to change other legal documents to represent our gender .

attributes.action: If we 'Remain', UK should have a referendum on our EU membership every 5 years.
attributes.background:
This proposal:

i)Addresses the democratic deficit – this mechanism gives the British people a regular say on this issue, ensuring we are not ignored for another 40 years

ii)Improves EU accountability - we elect UK Govts. every 5 years, EU membership & performance should be evaluated likewise.
attributes.additional_details:
Regular EU referendums offers numerous benefits; 

1.Accountability - it makes the EU more accountable knowing their performance is to be reviewed on a regular basis, 

2.UK interests - the EU will pay greater heed to the UK’s interests going forward, ensuring the EU develops in a manner more conducive to UK interests 

3.Other EU members states may follow suit and adopt similar measures, thereby making the EU more democratic and accountable to all the peoples of Europe.

attributes.action: To make the placing and/or using of snare traps illegal.
attributes.background: The use of snare traps is legal in the UK. However, this barbaric practice not only traps & kills foxes, which it is designed for, it also kills other wildlife (badgers, otters) & peoples pets too. The animal caught in a trap does not die swiftly, but is slowly (can take hours) strangled to death.
attributes.additional_details: Snare trapping involves setting a stiff but flexible steel wire in the shape of a crude noose on an animal trail. The wire is staked in the ground or attached to fence posts. When the animal goes to walk through the snare, it tightens around the animals neck & begins to strangle the animal slowly. If the animal struggles, the snare continues to tighten. One gamekeeper recounted a snare he set, was found on a dead badger over 500 yards away from original location, with fence post still attached.

attributes.action: Investigate and address the NHS Paramedic recruitment and retention crisis
attributes.background: Of 22000 HCPC registered Paramedics, only 40% work on the NHS frontline despite national recruitment drives. 1500 Paramedics are reportedly leaving the NHS every year. Despite 2000 newly qualified Paramedics since 2010, Qualified Ambulance Staff numbers have not increased.
attributes.additional_details:
HCPC Paramedic registrant numbers; http://www.hcpc-uk.co.uk/aboutregistration/professions/index.asp?id=10

HSCIC ambulance staff statistics for Qualified Ambulance Staff and Paramedics; http://www.hscic.gov.uk/catalogue/PUB16933/nhs-staf-2004-2014-non-med-tab.xls

National Health Executive, Paramedics leaving doubles; http://www.nationalhealthexecutive.com/News/rate-of-paramedics-leaving-ambulance-service-nearly-doubles

attributes.action: STOP fining parents & providing evidence of ill children who miss days of school
attributes.background: My child has missed many days of school due to Asthma. He has regular flare ups and suffers with coughing fits/ weasiness & breathlessness as a result also causing lack of sleep and the need to stay at home. We are facing a court proceedings because of his low school attendance percentage.
attributes.additional_details: We have had to provide /medical evidence' and letters of consent from a doctor to say he is unfit for school. This is discriminating against a parents' verbal word, making us feel like liars when our child is poorly. This takes up valuable doctors appointments, when our children are not always needed to be seen by a doctor. Other bugs fly around schools where we should also keep our children at home but not see a doctor. STOP PROSECUTING PARENTS for educational statistical targets!

attributes.action: Review the Work Capability Assessment to ensure it is not discriminatory!
attributes.background:
Currently anyone unable to work who is claiming benefits such as ESA needs to undertake a Work Capability Assessment (WCA).
The assessment checks to see what people are able to do and consists of a questionnaire and a predefined assessment.  It does not assess the impact of, e.g; mental health.
attributes.additional_details: In my own case I was assessed through WCA and then separately through an independent psychiatrist.  The WCA concluded I was able to work when the independent psychiatrist did not.  The issue is that to challenge the process is complex and a cause of distress for someone like me suffering with depression.  I found it too stressful to challenge.  A qualified professional should assess whether its the disability that affects a persons ability to work and not a series of irrelevant actions.

attributes.action: We request the government ban the sale of cotton style rodent bedding in shops.
attributes.background:
Cotton style (Cotton, wool, vegetable fibres) nesting material is harmful to pets yet is still sold in a number of shops nationwide. See Additional details for further information. 
I lost two hamsters to the bedding and after discovering it had happened to hundreds more, I started this campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
View http://www.hamsteradvice.com/ban-fluffy-bedding.html for information on how the bedding affects animals. It details how it causes harm internally, by causing blockages in the stomach and also wrapping round limbs which results in potential self-amputation. 

The material needs to be banned from pet shops, it has claimed the lives of thousands of pets and continues to do so with the lack of awareness on the dangers.

attributes.action:
Abolish money and work towards a resource-based economy.
The Venus project.
attributes.background:
Money is the root of all human suffering and corruption worldwide. It creates inequality on an enormous scale.
War, poverty, corruption, hunger, misery and unnecessary human suffering will not change in a monetary system, or will be insignificant change.
attributes.additional_details:
We now have the technological and scientific ability and intelligence to totally redesign our culture into something unrecognisable and highly sophisticated.

Monetary economies restrict human potential and cause unnecessary human suffering.
Abundance and sustainability are enemies of our current economic system as they do not allow for profit. The more restrictions and problems there are, the more opportunities there are to make money.

We need to stop this and create a fairer world for all.

attributes.action: Allow 15 - 17 Year Olds to be able to Vote in a 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.background: Since the Scottish Referendum in 2014 allowed voters as young as 16 to decide the future of their country, we believe that there should be a second referendum about Britain's EU membership, that allows voters as young as 15 to vote for our future.
attributes.additional_details: Many teenagers and young people were very well informed and very vocal about the EU referendum online, but in the end, were not given a chance to decide our own fate.

attributes.action: Reform the GCSE for child care level 3- so we do not need a C in GCSE
attributes.background: So other's who are capable of working with children but are not capable of gaining a GCSE'S at a C grade in English and Maths and still continue to qualify and be counted as a level 3.

attributes.action: Allow carers & disabled  to continue claiming benefits  while waiting for  MR
attributes.background:
With many disabled people having to ask for Mandatory Reconsideration and then  appeal they are often left unsupported while gov. depts and  legal system is snowed under unable to process appeals fast enough. 
In the majority of cases the appeals are won which means claimants are caused unnecessary
attributes.additional_details: hardship while waiting. Often with disastrous results. Volunteer carers are also effected often having their entire benefits cut to zero while waiting an outcome. This is unfair. If the system is so poorly designed that large numbers are having to appeal only to win their case then it is fair that the claimants should continue to receive benefits while waiting for an inadequate system to catch up. Even when an appeal is won no compensation for extra cost is awarded so penalizing the applicant

attributes.action: Fund a UK public information campaign to raise awareness of eating disorders
attributes.background: Eating disorders are severe illnesses, yet are widely misunderstood by the public and often subject to negative and misinformed attitudes. These misunderstandings and negative perceptions may stop people getting the help they need and deserve. A well-funded public education programme is needed.
attributes.additional_details: The public tend to underestimate the seriousness of eating disorders (Crisp et al., 2000; Easter, 2012; Mond et al., 2006) and may not view them as a ‘real’ mental illness (Easter, 2012). Despite genetic factors playing an important role in their causes (Jacobi et al., 2004), the general public tend to blame solely social/environmental factors (Bulik, 2004) as causes for eating disorders. The public also tend to believe the person has brought the illness on themselves  (Stewart et al., 2006).

attributes.action: Offer the NHS breast screening service to all women over the age of 21.
attributes.background:
On average every 1 in 8 women are diagnosed with breast cancer and early detection can significantly improve the chances of recovery.
In the UK the NHS currently invite all women between the ages of 50-70 years old for a mammogram every 3 years. I believe the age should be lowered to 21+.
attributes.additional_details: Further information about breast cancer and the options available to people who may be effected by this disease can be found on the NHS choices website.

attributes.action: Move Parliament outside of London during refurbishment of Palace of Westminster.
attributes.background: The refurbishment of the Palace of Westminster is a golden opportunity for MPs to pop the Westminster Bubble and re-engage with electorate. Let the Government shake off the archaic idiosyncrasies of a crumbling building and an overpriced, crowded city and actually get something done.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement. SENCO are only appointed if they have knowledge of ASD
attributes.background:
Special educational needs coordinators (SENCO's ) currently do not need to have any training or knowledge of any special education needs (SEN) to fulfil their job role in schools. 
How can SENCO support families and school and advise/coordinate care on a topic they have no  knowledge/experience of?

attributes.action: We call on the Government to hold a Referendum to Reform the House of Lords ,
attributes.background: There are 826 Members of the House of Lords the average daily attendance is around 483, the net operating costs for the chamber totalled 94.4 million four 2014/2015, of this 20.7 million was spent on members allowances and expenses. Surely this should be put to a referendum of the people.
attributes.additional_details: if they can certify that they have carried out appropriate Parliamentary work in Westminster they are entitled to claim a tax-free daily allowance of £300, also they can choose to claim a lower rate of £150 tax-free for work away from Westminster. We call on the Government to hold a Referendum to Reform the House of Lords by having a Second Chamber Elected from the Nations and Regions throughout the UK,

attributes.action: Affiliate all Primary and Secondary schools with an elderly care facility.
attributes.background:
The most beneficial thing we can do as a society is to find positive & mutually beneficial ways to integrate different groups. 
We should link schools with care homes etc, & have the children/young adults spend occasional classes helping at the facility, to develop relationships across generations.
attributes.additional_details:
There are roughly 2 schools for every care home in the UK, and the government predicts that we need to double the number of elderly care facilities over the next 20 years.
There already exists major concern, and huge gaps in the system. Workers in this field could certainly benefit from the involvement and support of the larger community.
It is well researched how beneficial generational integration is to elderly folk and youngsters alike. I feel it a wasted opportunity to not connect the two.

attributes.action: Amend Environment Protection Act to allow prompt rubbish removal on private land
attributes.background: Fly-tipping in many areas is getting out of hand. Often, rubbish is dumped in privately-owned alleys, garage areas, etc. Soon, the dumping is extended to adjacent pavements. The legal process for local authoritues to gain access, clear the land and recoup expenses is lengthy and costly.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst the local authority embarks on the legal process, the problem escalates and more work is then required to keep on top of the rubbish now accruing in the public space.  The heaps of rubbish present health, fire and other safety risks in the meantime.

Local authorities should be allowed to issue a warning letter with a short notice period to remove the rubbish. Guidance and assistance should be provided to those landowners affected by persistent fly-tipping through no fault of there own.

attributes.action: Make LA's provide Post 16 Autism specific education provision in the local area
attributes.background: There are not enough education provisions for autistic young people aged 16+ within local areas. This is such a difficult transitional stage in their lives and many are forced to travel long distances in order to attend an appropriate provision that can meet their individual needs. This has to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
As a parent of an autistic child I feel incredibly anxious regarding this issue. 
Transition from child to adult services is difficult and I feel by continuing education within the local community, would promote much better long term outcomes for individuals as well as their families. I also believe it would be financially better for Local Authorities to provide this rather than sending these vunerable members of society out of borough. So please sign this and let's make a positive change now

attributes.action: Discuss ways to ensure all private landlords protect deposits paid by tenants
attributes.background: Though the Housing Act 2004, Section 213 lays out what is expected of  private landlords and the requirements relating to tenancy deposits; a significant amount of private landlords fail to protect deposits put down by their tenants and escape the penalty for failing to do so.
attributes.additional_details: I am asking that the government discuss creating measures to ensure that all tenancy deposits are protected in a government backed scheme by private landlords. I submit that landlords should face a penalty for failing to protect tenancy deposits immediately after 30 days and not solely if a tenant takes their landlord to court usually half way through or at the end of a tenancy agreement.

attributes.action: Stop selling off public assets in the false name of austerity.
attributes.background:
The Tories have privatised MORE in 6 years than Thatcher's government did in 10. 
The Post Office was sold off for record losses. 
The NHS is being sold off piece by piece under our noses. 
If you feel 'free' (paid by YOUR taxes) healthcare is essential to a healthy,prospering society, sign.
attributes.additional_details:
Video breaks austerity myth:
http://www.thecanary.co/2016/02/03/editor-chief-canary-smashes-austerity-bits-video/

why are rail fares extortionate? :
http://gu.com/p/4ffcp?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

Post office sold privately:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/money/markets/article-3111010/Government-sell-remainder-Royal-Mail-shares-raise-1-5bn.html

Article explaining privatisation surge in NHS:
http://www.thecanary.co/2016/02/08/cameron-just-launched-privatisation-surge-end-nhs-time-leaves-office/

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act for child contact denial to be accountable for.
attributes.background: Resident parents who deny contact between their children and the non-resident parent without due cause should be held accountable. It is a form of psychological child abuse. Justice for the affected children whose resident parents think they can play with their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why contact is stopped:
1. The resident parent (RP) wants to start a new life and wants the non resident parent (NRP) out of the way.  
2. The RP wants money/property from the NRP and uses the children as bargaining pawns. 
3. The RP may see children as a way of getting a house, welfare money, and other benefits. 
4. The RP is possessive and wants all the children’s love. 
5. The RP dislikes the NRP new partner, who they see as a rival 'parent', so prevents the child seeing the NRP.

attributes.action: Right to Buy - 70% discount should mean exactly that: 70% means 70%
attributes.background: Recently the Government have implemented various measures in order to meet their own targets of house purchases within the UK. The Help to Buy scheme (including ISAs), the 20% discount on market prices for approximately 100,000 first time buyers under 40yrs of age etc. Both schemes are ageist.
attributes.additional_details:
One popular scheme, the Right to Buy has been amended by Government to the extent that it is now also discriminatory towards long term tenants as no qualifying tenant receives the full 70% discount due to Government capping. Such tenants are stuck in the rent trap, many of them being in their 50s and unable to secure a mortgage on normal terms in order to buy on the open market.

We urge the Government to rethink its stance and make the full 70% discount mean 70%.

Check out our Facebook page.

attributes.action: The UK must not leave the European Economic Area (EEA) without a referendum
attributes.background: The UK voted in a referendum on 23rd June 2016 to leave the European Union. No referendum has been held on whether the UK should leave the European Economic Area (EEA). Therefore we, the undersigned, ask HM Government to legislate that the United Kingdom cannot leave the EEA without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The European Economic Area (EEA) comprises all 28 EU member states plus Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. Membership of the EU and EEA is separate, as evidenced by Croatia's joining of the EU on 1st July 2013 and its delayed provisional joining of the EEA on 12th April 2014. Most rights enjoyed by citizens of EU countries apply equally to citizens of EEA countries, most notably the free movement of people. If the UK leaves the EU without leaving the EEA, it will be similar to Norway or Iceland.

attributes.action: Allow UKSA to prosecute politicians who state incorrect statistics
attributes.background: In the recent campaign the Leave side kept mentioning the incorrect £350m amount going to the EU. The head of the ONS asked them to stop but they didn't. The UKSA should be able to prosecute politicians, political parties and campaigns from repeating incorrect stats and force to print retractions.
attributes.additional_details:
These 2 articles relate to the £350m claim.
https://fullfact.org/blog/2016/apr/uk-statistics-authority-350-million-eu-membership-fee-potentially-misleading/
www.theguardian.com/politics/reality-check/2016/may/23/does-the-eu-really-cost-the-uk-350m-a-week

As this article describes the UKSA are the organisation required to point out to politicians where they misuse statistics but they lack the teeth to do more.
www.bbc.co.uk/news/blogs-magazine-monitor-28061826

attributes.action: Institute an independent audit system for the EU Referendum count.
attributes.background: Recent elections have demonstrated an alarming series of errors which may be, or have been, deliberately used to distort the result beyond acceptable limits. There is no confidence in the Electoral Commission UK in their own handling of the necessary oversights at each stage of the process.
attributes.additional_details:
A series of known tactics are possibly being used to distort the result beyond acceptable margins, e.g. Barnet registers omitting names, May 2016; East Devon registers contains names which should not have been there, May 2015; South Thanet General Election count delay for twelve hours being unexplained, May 2015; the Legality of a variety of Electoral procedures being ignored by parties 2014-2015.Etc. 
A team of three independent inspectors must be appointed by an MP's Committee for each counting centre.

attributes.action: Make Commercial Dog Walking a licensed and inspected practice.
attributes.background: In recent years, Commercial dog walking has become big business. Seemingly, all people need is a van & a love of dogs. Some provide excellent service helping our dogs to have a better life whilst we work, however there are many who walk up to 20 dogs, do not clean up, & cannot control the pack.
attributes.additional_details: Kennels & Boarders are licenced & inspected & must be suitable people, trained and insured to protect OUR pets. I have seen many Commercial Dog Walkers who cannot control the dogs they walk. The dogs foul areas & act as a pack, causing fear/ injury to other dog walkers, dogs, livestock & land users. A license should be a requirement to allow Authorities to inspect vehicles used to transport dogs, check on insurance and the walkers experience. Numbers walked commercially must also be limited.

attributes.action: Deactivation of implantable defibrillators (pacemakers) for Dementia Sufferers
attributes.background:
A widower says his dying wife’s life was prolonged unnecessarily because a pacemaker kept her alive after all hope of recovery was lost.
Abergele Pensioner - Ron Hastings’ wife Patricia suffered from vascular dementia and organ failure, and died in a local nursing home.
attributes.additional_details:
Medical experts say while the devices have helped keep thousands of people alive, there are times when prolonging life is not appropriate.
Mr Hastings, from Abergele , said he has now written to to his local representative, calling on them to make sure measures are in place. 
He said: “Pat was trying to breathe. The pacemaker would kick in and give her another few minutes and it would happen again.

http://www.dailypost.co.uk/news/north-wales-news/abergele-womans-life-unnecessarily-prolonged-11130453

attributes.action: Debate restrictions on the sale of button batteries.
attributes.background: Button batteries are an under recognised and unregulated risk to children. They look like sweets and are sold without restriction or appropriate packaging on the high street.  When swallowed they often get stuck in the throat cause severe burns with life threatening complications.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.rospa.com/home-safety/advice/product/button-cell-batteries/

http://www.afpp.org.uk/filegrab/1psa-button-batteries.pdf?ref=1923

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/campaigns/give-to-gosh/great-ormond-street-hospital-surgeon-warns-of-the-dangers-of-button-batteries-a6783641.html

attributes.action: Change the cannabis law to allow use to be allowed and sold within special shops
attributes.background: Banning the use of a naturally growing plant seems draconian and giving people a criminal record who need it for medical reasons is not right, by the uk banning it's use the black market is able to generate millions from its sale and that money probably is used to fund terrorism
attributes.additional_details:
In Amsterdam the use and sale of cannabis is toloreated within special shops called coffee shops, it's a safe place for people to use the drug and to buy the drug without being exposed to "hard" drugs such as cocaine and heroin - also the cannabis in Amsterdam is of a higher quality and therefore safer to consume than black market cannabis which could be sprayed with any number of chemicals and/or sprayed with glass to bulk up its weight prior to sale 

Drug dealers are not concerned with health

attributes.action: Do not reduce or remove tax relief from pension contirbutions
attributes.background: Mr Osborne is looking at reducing the tax relief on pension contributions. This will seriously effect people making pension contributions into PRIVATE pensions. Therefore meaning that people will have a much reduced pension when they retire.
attributes.additional_details: Automatic enrolment was to ensure that people were contributing into a private pension to provide a decent pension when they retire. It was also quoting the fact the government would also contribute the tax relief to your pension. Even if the reduction Mr Osborne only effects the Higher tax payers as the higher tax band has not been increased in line with wages this option will affect more & more people.  Any one earning over £42385 pays 40% tax.

attributes.action: Ban the burqa and face veils in Schools, Courts, Shopping Centre's etc.
attributes.background: Take action before its to late, better to prevent than look back and say what if.
attributes.additional_details: With the world being as it is at this present time it would be easier on the security forces and public services to identify people easily.

attributes.action: Stop providing security for Tony Blair's Overseas commitments
attributes.background: Taxpayers are still footing Tony Blairs huge police protection bill. In some cases 12 Metropolitan Officers are involved at a cost to the tax payer of upto £16,000.00 per week.  This equates to an enormous amount of money over the past 6 years.
attributes.additional_details: His firm, Tony Blair Associates has made vast amounts of money over the past 6 years, and both his private and commercial work has taken him all over the world with round the clock protection, to which he should at least make a substantial contribution.

attributes.action: Petition, Allow MARINE LE PEN into the U.K. to give her Views On British Brexit.
attributes.background: Cameron allowed Obama into the U.K. To meet the Queen & to give his views on British Remaining in The E.U.
attributes.additional_details: Why allow Barack Hussein Obama, but not allow Donald Trump & Marine Le Pen, when Marine Le Pen has a European Passport?

attributes.action: Allow Practice nurses employed prior to 6/3/1990 to retain Special Class Status
attributes.background: Because I became a practice nurse prior to 6/3/98 I have lost my right to retire without penalties at 55yrs, despite never having a break in my career. SCS nurses entering into General Practice after 6/3/1990 are entitled to retire at 55yrs, if they have not had a break of more than 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Many nurses that have paid into the NHS pension scheme without a break of more than 5 years have the right to retire at the age of 55 years without penalty(this right was abolished for new nurses after 6/3/1995).  GP nurses were excluded from the pension scheme until 1/9/1997 so many have incurred a forced break of more than 5 yrs.(A period of time 6/3/95 - 31/8/97 is ignored) For those employed in GP work prior to 6/3/1990 the SCS has been removed and is unfair.

attributes.action: Give consent to listed building owners who want to replace unoriginal features
attributes.background: Listed building consent uses the phrase "alter the character". This isn't defined further. We assert that the "character" should refer to the state of the property when it was first built and not refer to later alterations. An owner should be able to change such alterations without fear of sanction.
attributes.additional_details: In my case we have a conservation officer who wants to preserve incongruous 1970's paraphernalia (carpeted avocado bathrooms, blue concrete floors and artex ceilings) in an 1870's building. Vaguely written or subjectively interpretable laws, whose consequences actually act in opposition to their purpose (encouraging rather than dissuading investment in conservation) should be challenged.

attributes.action: Introduce controls to curb the sky rocketing cost of renting within London.
attributes.background: The cost of renting is rising exponentially each year, leading to people living in sub-standard accommodation. Not everyone in London wishes to buy and while the government focuses on increasing the supply of affordable housing, it is hard to see how this will help curb extortionate rental prices.
attributes.additional_details:
It is difficult to find a 2 bed flat in zones 1-3 for less than £1450pm. This leads to young adults, families & students who aren't looking to buy or are trying to save a deposit living in overcrowded, shared accommodation. 
For most, there is little option but to turn to rental websites like 'Spareroom' and move into the ex-living room of a 3 bed shared house for £600 pm. If you are lucky, there will be 1 bathroom per 4 people. Sadly, most spend more than half their income on ever rising rent.

attributes.action: Reform education, make it evidence based ato protect our children from stress.
attributes.background:
Children in the UK are some of the youngest to enter formal education & some of the most tested in Europe with no associated benefits. Other countries in Europe have better long term academic outcomes starting formal education at 7.
A radical overhaul of education is needed to protect our children.
attributes.additional_details: With large numbers of staff leaving the profession & many children suffering stress & depression, let's take a more evidence based approach to education.  In a culture which pushes mothers to return to work, home schooling isn't an option many can afford.  Let's give children a better start in life. Let them play & be kids not test them & force them to act as walking calculators & dictionaries. Let schooling from ages 4-7 be ALL about learning through play, not the 3 r's. They are our future.

attributes.action: Improve accessibility to state benefits for the poor and sick.
attributes.background: ESA living allowances must rise. Many get nothing beyond a partner's low income, creating hardship. Allowances for age should end. Under 25s get less than over 25s though their needs are the same. Eligibility criteria for Income Support should widen beyond lone parents, the pregnant and carers.
attributes.additional_details:
With greater accessibility to benefits, the sick could focus more on their health. The foundation of state support would ease the suffering of people with mental illnesses, enabling greater engagement in treatment, and hastening their return to the workforce.

Relying on a partner's low income hurts one's mental health, and much dignity is lost without the independence of a personal income. For those just above the income threshold, this will mean financial and emotional hardship.

attributes.action: Abolish the 2 year retake of the CBT.
attributes.background: Every two years I, as many other "L" riders, have to fork out another £90 to retake my compulsory bike test. I have no need to apply for my full  larger engine test due to my short commute (a full 15 miles a day). I do not know of any other vehicle licences that need to have a two year "refresher".

attributes.action: create a law to make all cyclists wear correctly fitting cycle helmets
attributes.background:
This is along the same lines as the law for the use and fitting of seat belts in cars  
Look how many lives have been saved since the introduction of the above law

attributes.action: Alter English National Curriculum to spread grammar evenly over the 4 Key Stages
attributes.background: Because standards of grammar dropped over recent years, educators are now expected to cover the majority of the curriculum for grammar over Key Sages 1 and 2 (ages 5-11).  This material should be spread over the 4 Key Stages.
attributes.additional_details: So much grammar is being shoe-horned into primary writing that the result is stressed educators, anxious children and unnatural writing.  Many parents themselves are unaware of what is expected of their children and are therefore unable to support them effectively.

attributes.action: Make NHS gender service waiting times easier for transgender people
attributes.background: I am asking to ease the long waiting times for gender services in the UK, by allowing trans people to begin reversible treatment before they are seen by a specialist. This would prevent them from struggling with crippling gender dysphoria while they are on the waiting list, which can be over a year.
attributes.additional_details:
Lots of trans patients suffer with gender dysphoria, which in turn causes depression and suicidal feelings. Not being able to begin treatment can have a severe impact on mental health.
Many trans people take hormone blockers. This is a drug which is completely safe, 100% reversible and prevents trans people from going through changes which don't match their gender identity. All I ask is that the use of hormone blockers in the waiting period is considered, so their general wellbeing is improved.
